gurmukhi: ਕਿ ਪਾਰੰਗ ਗੰਤਾ ॥ ਕਿ ਅਾਧਰਮ ਹੰਤਾ ॥ ਕਿ ਸੰਨਯਾਸ ਭਕਤਾ ॥ ਕਿ ਸਾਜੋਜ ਮੁਕਤਾ ॥੨੪੦॥
transliteration: Ki Paaran Gadtaa|| Ki Aadharam Hantaa|| Ki Sanyaas Bhaktaa|| Ki Saajoj Mouktaa||240||
translation: He was the destroyer of impiety, a devotee of the path of Sannyas, of Jivan-mukta (redeemed while living) and was skilful in all learnings.240.

gurmukhi: ਕਿ ਅਾਸਕਤ ਕਰਮੰ ॥ ਕਿ ਅਬਿਯਕਤ ਧਰਮੰ ॥ ਕਿ ਅੱਤੇਵ ਜੋਗੀ ॥ ਕਿ ਅੰਗੰ ਅਰੋਗੀ ॥੨੪੧॥
transliteration: Ki Aasakat Karman|| Ki Abiyakat Dharman|| Ki Attev Jogee|| Ki Anadgdarogee||241||
translation: He was absorbed in good deeds, an unattached Yogi; he was like unmanifested Dharma devoid of Yoga; his limbs were healthy.241.

gurmukhi: ਕਿ ਸੁਧੰ ਸੁਰੋਸੰ ॥ ਨ ਨੈਕ ਅੰਗਰੋਸੰ ॥ ਨ ਕੁਕਰਮ ਕਰਤਾ ॥ ਕਿ ਧਰਮੰ ਸੁ ਸਰਤਾ ॥੨੪੨॥
transliteration: Ki Soundhan Surosan|| Na Naik Anrosan|| Na Koukaram Kartaa|| Ki Dharamannd Su Sartaa||242||
translation: He was never in ire, even slightly; no vice touched him and he ever flowed like the river of Dharma.242.

gurmukhi: ਕਿ ਜੋਗਾਧਿਕਾਰੀ ॥ ਕਿ ਸੰਨਯਾਸ ਧਾਰੀ ॥ ਕਿ ਬ੍ਹਮੰਸ ਭਗਤਾ ॥ ਕਿ ਅਾਰੰਭ ਜਗਤਾ ॥੨੪੩॥
transliteration: Ki Johaadhikdaree|| Ki Sannyaas Dhdaree|| Ki Brahmans Bhagtaa|| Ki Aaranbh Jagtaa||243||
translation: He adopted Sannyas and was the supreme authority of Yoga; he was the devotee of Brahman, the originator of the world.243.

gurmukhi: ਕਿ ਜਾਟਾਨ ਜੂਟੰ ॥ ਕਿ ਨਿਧਿਅਾਨ ਛੂਟੰ ॥ ਕਿ ਅਬਿਯਕਤ ਅੰਗੰ ॥ ਕਿ ਕੈਪਾਨ ਭੰਗੰ ॥੨੪੪॥
transliteration: Ki Jaatan Jeetan|| Ki Nidhaan Chootan|| Ki Abiyakat Anadg|| Ki Kaipaan Bhanadg||244||
translation: That king wearing matted locks, had abandoned all the stores of materials; and he wore waist-cloth.24.

gurmukhi: ਕਿ ਸੰਨਯਾਸ ਕਰਮੀ ॥ ਕਿ ਰਾਵੱਲ ਧਰਮੀ ॥ ਕਿ ਤ੍ਰਿਕਾਲ ਕੁਸਲੀ ॥ ਕਿ ਕਾਮੱਦਿ ਦੁਸਲੀ ॥੨੪੫॥
transliteration: Ki Sannyaas Karmee|| Ki Raavall Dharmee|| Ki Trikaal Kouslee|| Ki Kaamadd(i) Douslee||145||
translation: He performed actions of Sannyas and adopted Rawal religion; he always remained in bliss and was the destroyer of lust etc.245.

gurmukhi: ਕਿ ਡਾਮਾਰ ਬਾਜੈ ॥ ਕਿ ਸਭ ਪਾਪ ਭਾਜੈ ॥ ਕਿ ਬਿਭੂਤ ਸੋਹੈ ॥ ਕਿ ਸਰਬਤ੍ਰ ਮੋਹੈ ॥੨੪੬॥
transliteration: Ki Daamaar Baajai|| Ki Sabh Paap Bhaajai|| Ki Bibhoot Sohai|| Ki Satbata Mohair||246||
translation: The tabors were being played, hearing which all the sins had fled away; his body had been smeared with ashes and all were getting allured towards him.246.

gurmukhi: ਕਿ ਲੰਗੋਟ ਬੰਦੀ ॥ ਕਿ ੲੇਕਾਦਿ ਛੰਦੀ ॥ ਕਿ ਧਰਮਾਨ ਧਰਤਾ ॥ ਕਿ ਪਾਪਾਨ ਹਰਤਾ ॥੨੪੭॥
transliteration: Ki Lanot Bandee|| Ki Ekaadh Chhandee|| Ki Dharmaan Dhartaa|| Ki Paapaan Hartaa||247||
translation: He wore loin-cloth and spoke occasionally; he was the adopter of piety and destroyer of sin.247.

gurmukhi: ਕਿ ਨਿਨਾਦਿ ਬਾਜੈ ॥ ਕਿ ਪੰਪਾਪ ਭਾਜੈ ॥ ਕਿ ਅਾਦੇਸ ਬੁੱਲੈਂ ॥ ਕਿ ਲੈ ਗ੍ਰੰਥ ਖੁੱਲੈਂ ॥੨੪੮॥
transliteration: Ki Ninaadh Baajai|| Ki Panpap Bhaajai|| Ki Aades Bullain|| Ki Lai Gadanth Khullain||248||
translation: The horn was being blown and the sins were running away; the orders were given there that the religious texts be read.248.

gurmukhi: ਕਿ ਪਾਵਿਤ੍ਰ ਦੇਸੀ ॥ ਕਿ ਧਰਮੇਂਦ੍ਰ ਭੇਸੀ ॥ ਕਿ ਲੰਗੋਟ ਬੰਦੰ ॥ ਕਿ ਅਾਜੋਤ ਵੰਦੰ ॥੨੪੯॥
transliteration: Ki Paavitra Desee|| Ki Dharmendra Bhesee|| Ki Lanot Bandan|| Ki Aajot Vandan||249||
translation: In that holy country, assuming the religious garb, the prayer was being held, thinking of that one wearing the lion-cloth as effulgence.249.

gurmukhi: ਕਿ ਅਾਨਰਥ ਰਹਿਤਾ ॥ ਕਿ ਸੰਨਯਾਸ ਸਹਿਤਾ ॥ ਕਿ ਪਰਮੰ ਪੁਨੀਤੰ ॥ ਕਿ ਸਰਬਤ੍ਰ ਮੀਤੰ ॥੨੫੦॥
transliteration: Kiaanarth Rahitaa|| Ki Sannyaas Sahitaa|| Ki Parman Pouneetan|| Ki Sarbatra Meetan||250||
translation: He was devoid of misfortune and attached to Sannyas; he was supremely immaculate and friend of all.250.

gurmukhi: ਕਿ ਅਚਾਚੱਲ ਅੰਗੰ ॥ ਕਿ ਜੋਗੰ ਅਭੰਗੰ ॥ ਕਿ ਅਬਿਯਕਤ ਰੂਪੰ ॥ ਕਿ ਸੰਨਿਅਾਸ ਭੂਪੰ ॥੨੫੧॥
transliteration: Ki Achaachall Anadg|| Ki Jouang Abhanadg|| Ki Abiyak Atroopan|| Ki Sanaaiaas Bhoopan||251||
translation: He was absorbed in yoga, having indescribable form; he was a Sannyasi king.251.

gurmukhi: ਕਿ ਬੀਰਾਨ ਰਾਧੀ ॥ ਕਿ ਸਰਬਤ੍ਰ ਸਾਧੀ ॥ ਕਿ ਪਾਵਿਤ੍ਰ ਕਰਮਾ ॥ ਕਿ ਸੰਨਯਾਸ ਧਰਮਾ ॥੨੫੨॥
transliteration: Ki Beeraan Raadhee|| Ki Sarbatra Saadhee|| Ki Paavitra Karmaa|| Ki Sannyaas Dharmaa||252||
translation: He was the hero of heroes and practiser of all the disciplines; he was a Sannyasi, performing underrfiled actions.252.

gurmukhi: ਅਧਾਖੰਡ ਰੰਗੰ ॥ ਕਿ ਅਾਛਿੱਜ ਅੰਗੰ ॥ ਕਿ ਅਨਯਾੲਿ ਹਰਤਾ ॥ ਕਿ ਸੁ ਨਯਾੲਿ ਕਰਤਾ ॥੨੫੩॥
transliteration: Adhaakhannddranadg|| Ki Aachhijj Anadg|| Ki Anyaae Hartaa|| Ki Su Nyaae Kartaa||253||
translation: He was like that Lord, who is imperishable, and just, the remover of injustice.253.
